math_problem.A2263: Alice and Bob are playing in the forest. They have six sticks of length $1,2,3,4,5,6$ inches. Somehow, they have managed to arrange these sticks, such that they form the sides of an equiangular hexagon. Compute the sum of all possible values of the area of this hexagon. Instead of computing the sum of all possible values of the area of this hexagon, simply find $e = (d + 208)$, where $d$ is the smaller possible value of the length of the fourth side in an arrangement starting with the shortest stick as the first side.

math_problem.A2268: Let $N$ be the largest positive integer that can be expressed as a 2013-digit base -4 number. What is the remainder when $N$ is divided by 210?
